tmf
[Groovy] Class Te

java.lang.Object
  tmf.Sn
      tmf.Te

@InheritConstructors
class Te
extends Sn

A Terminological Entry contains information on terminological units (i.e., subject-specific concepts, terms, etc.) Information pertains to a single concept, as described in ISO 16642. It usually contains, for example, the terms assigned to a concept, descriptive information pertinent to concept, and administrative information concerning the concept. It can contain one or two Language Sections depending on whether the termbase is conceptual or bilingual Note: Multilingual Terminological Entries (i.e. three or more Language Sections) are not supported.

Authors:
Stephane Aubry
See Also:

tovaNamesForTe is the list of Transitive OVerwritable Attributes names applicable to Terminological Entries. It is a subset of tovaNames of Tdc class.

Parameters:

See Also:
Ls

populate

def populate(Node node, Map tovas, String subjectField)
Fills the Terminological Entry with data read from the Freeplane node. Details of the created Information Units:
  • context = node's note (only if the Terminological Entry is conceptual)
  • customerSubset
  • definition = node's details (only if the Terminological Entry is conceptual)
  • entryIdentifier = node's id
  • projectSubset
  • sourceLanguage and targetLanguage (only if the Terminological Entry is bilingual)
Details of the created Language Sections:
  • If the node contains a '=' then two Language Sections are created (one SOURCE and one TARGET)
  • Else one Language Sections is created (CONCEPT)
Parameters:
node - The node of the Terminological Entry in the Freeplane map.
tovas - The map node of Transitive OVerwritable Attributes. Keys of the map entries are attribute names.
See Also:
Iu
Ls

toGmt

def toGmt(MarkupBuilder xml)
Outputs the Terminological Entry in an XML format. The format is named GMT (Generic Mapping Tool) and is specified in ISO 16642. The Terminological Entry is transformed into an XML element named struct with the XML attribute type = "TE".
Parameters:
xml - MarkupBuilder
